# Call for Papers: 37th Euromicro Conference on Real-Time Systems (ECRTS’25)

ECRTS 2025 will be held from **July 8–11, 2025**, in **Brussels, Belgium**. The conference will be held physically, with streaming possibilities for those unable to attend in person.

## About ECRTS

ECRTS is the premier European venue for real-time systems research and is ranked among the top three international conferences on the topic, alongside RTSS and RTAS. It has a history of fostering innovation, including artifact evaluation, open access proceedings, industry challenges, and real-time pitches.

## Scope and Topics of Interest

Papers on all aspects of timing requirements in computer systems are welcome, including hard real-time systems and time-sensitive systems with soft timing requirements. Relevant application domains include automotive, avionics, telecommunications, healthcare, robotics, and space systems, among others. To be in scope, papers must address some form of timing requirement.

ECRTS welcomes theoretical and practical contributions (including tools, benchmarks, and case studies). Papers on industrial case studies and the application of real-time technology to real systems are particularly encouraged.

Topics of interest include, but are not limited to:

*   **Time-sensitive SOFTWARE SYSTEMS:** operating systems, hypervisors, middleware, programming languages, compilers, runtime environments, networks, communication protocols.
*   **COMPUTER HARDWARE** design and integration for embedded systems: time-predictable hardware, GPU and accelerators, FPGA prototyping, SoC design, memory architectures, hardware/software co-design.
*   **REAL-TIME NETWORKS:** wired and wireless sensor/actuator networks, Time-Sensitive Networks (TSN), industrial IoT, Software Defined Network (SDN), 5G, end-to-end latency analysis.
*   **REAL-TIME APPLICATIONS:** modeling, design, simulation, testing, debugging, and evaluation in domains such as automotive, avionics, control systems, industrial automation, robotics, space, railways, telecommunications, multimedia.
*   **Foundational SCHEDULING and PREDICTABILITY:** schedulability analysis, algorithm design, synchronization protocols, computational complexity, temporal isolation, probabilistic guarantees, multi-core scheduling, resource co-scheduling.
*   **RESOURCE DEMAND ESTIMATION:** stochastic and worst-case execution time (WCET) analysis, memory and bandwidth bounding, energy, power, or thermal footprint analysis.
*   **MACHINE LEARNING** techniques in safety-critical systems: explainable AI, application of ML to real-time systems design and optimization, real-time AI computing methods.
*   **FORMAL METHODS** for verification and validation: model checking, computer-assisted proofs, runtime monitoring.
*   **SECURITY aspects** of real-time systems: strengthening security guarantees, protecting the temporal envelope, privacy-enhancing techniques.
*   The interplay of timing predictability and other **NON-FUNCTIONAL QUALITIES:** reliability, quality of control, energy/power consumption, environmental impact, testability, scalability.

Papers that break new ground or challenge the status quo are highly encouraged.

## Open Access

All accepted papers will be published as open-access proceedings in collaboration with LIPIcs (Leibniz International Proceedings in Informatics) and will be accessible at [drops.dagstuhl.de/entities/conference/ECRTS](https://drops.dagstuhl.de/entities/conference/ECRTS).

## Paper Submission

*   **Submission deadline:** February 28, 2025 (Firm)
*   **Submission website:** [https://ecrts25.hotcrp.com/](https://ecrts25.hotcrp.com/)
*   Submitted manuscripts are limited to **20 pages** of technical content, excluding the bibliography.
*   Every accepted paper must be presented by one of the authors at the conference.
*   **Paper Template:** LIPIcs template (available at [https://submission.dagstuhl.de/series/details/5#author](https://submission.dagstuhl.de/series/details/5#author))
*   **Submission Instructions:** Please review and follow the [submission instructions](https://www.ecrts.org/submission-instructions/) and guidelines.

## Double-Blind Peer Reviewing

ECRTS will follow a double-blind peer reviewing process. Authors must submit blinded manuscripts, and reviewers will not be made aware of author identities. More details can be found in the [double-blind submission policy](https://www.ecrts.org/double-blind-submission/).

## Shadow Peer Review Process

Authors can opt-in to a Shadow Technical Program Committee (TPC) option for additional review experience. Reviews from the Shadow TPC will not affect the final decision. Learn more about the [Shadow TPC evaluation process](https://www.ecrts.org/shadow-tpc-evaluation-process/).

## Artifact Evaluation

Authors of accepted papers with a computational component are invited to submit their code and/or data to an optional [artifact evaluation process](https://www.ecrts.org/artifact-evaluation/) to improve reproducibility and encourage reuse.

## Important Dates

*   **Submission deadline:** February 28, 2025 (Firm, UTC-12)

*   **Camera-ready deadline:** May 16, 2025
*   **Early registration deadline:** June 13, 2025
*   **Conference:** July 8 - 11, 2025

# Call for Papers: ECMFA 2025

The 21st European Conference on Modelling Foundations and Applications (ECMFA) is soliciting papers presenting original research on all aspects of model-based engineering (MBE).

## Aims and Scope

ECMFA is the premier European forum dedicated to advancing the state of knowledge and fostering the application of all aspects of MBE and related approaches. It aims to engage key figures in research and industry to enhance the practical application of MBE, leading to more reliable software based on state-of-the-art research results.

## Submission Types

Two types of submissions are invited:

*   **Foundation Papers:** These papers should deal with modeling foundations, such as metamodeling, model transformations, model validation, verification and testing, model engineering methods and tools, and related aspects.
*   **Application Papers:** These papers should focus on the application of modeling techniques, including experience reports on the use of MBE methods and tools, industrial case studies, or successful applications of MBE practices in industry or public administration, with significant modeling lessons learned. All applications must have been done in real contexts, and at least one author must be affiliated with the company or administration where the application took place.

## Submission Process

*   Submissions must conform to the JOT LaTeX template ([https://www.jot.fm/templates/jot.zip](https://www.jot.fm/templates/jot.zip)).
*   Papers must not exceed **14 pages** (including figures, references, and appendices). Secondary studies may use 2 additional pages for references only.
*   Failure to conform to these guidelines may result in disqualification.
*   Simultaneous submission to other publication outlets is not allowed and will result in immediate rejection.
*   All submissions will be peer-reviewed by at least three members of the Program Committee.
*   Papers must be submitted electronically in PDF format through Easychair (link to be published).

## Topics of Interest

Topics of interest include, but are not limited to:

*   Foundations of MBE, including model transformations, domain-specific languages, verification and validation approaches, etc.
*   Novel paradigms, formalisms, applications, approaches, frameworks, or processes for model-based engineering such as low-code/no-code development, digital twins, etc.
*   Interplay between MBE with and for AI-based systems.
*   Application of MBE methods, tools, and techniques to specific domains, e.g., automotive, aerospace, cyber-physical systems, robotics, Artificial Intelligence or IoT.
*   Successful use of MBE in connection with other disciplines and approaches, such as Artificial Intelligence, DevOps, Open Source, or Safety Assurance.
*   Educational aspects of MBE.
*   Tools and initiatives for the successful adoption of MBE in industry.

## Review Criteria and Process

The program committee will assess all papers for novelty, significance, technical quality, rigor, and suitability for the conference. Papers accepted with revisions will be given a period to perform revisions and re-submit. Accepted papers will be published as platinum open-access journal publications in JOT.

## Artifacts

Artifacts are recommended but not required for the initial submission. Reviewers may consider the existence of artifacts positively, and they may be required for publication.

## Publication

All accepted papers will be published as platinum open-access journal publications in JOT. At least one author for each accepted paper must register before the early registration deadline and present the paper during the conference. Failure to do so will result in the paper being withdrawn from the proceedings.

# Call for Papers

Authors are invited to submit manuscripts reporting original, unpublished research and recent developments in Computational Sciences. All accepted papers will be included in the Springer Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS) series and indexed by Scopus, EI Engineering Index, Thomson Reuters Conference Proceedings Citation Index (included in ISI Web of Science), and several other indexing services. The papers will contain linked references, XML versions and citable DOI numbers.

## Scope and Topics

ICCS 2025 invites original contributions on all topics related to Computational Science, including, but not limited to:

*   Scientific Computing
*   Problem Solving Environments
*   Advanced Numerical Algorithms
*   Complex Systems: Modeling and Simulation
*   Hybrid Computational Methods
*   Web- and Grid-based Simulation and Computing
*   Parallel and Distributed Computing
*   Advanced Computing Architectures and New Programming Models
*   Visualization and Virtual Reality as Applied to Computational Science
*   Applications of Computation as a Scientific Paradigm
*   New Algorithmic Approaches to Computational Kernels and Applications
*   Computational Humanities
*   Education in Computational Science
*   Large Scale Scientific Instruments
*   Computational Sociology
*   Medical and Biomedical Computational Science
*   Computational Physics
*   Quantum Computing
*   Uncertainty Quantification
*   Artificial Intelligence in Scientific Computing
*   Complex Systems Simulations
*   System Dynamics Models
*   Complex Networks Models and High Performance simulations
*   Massive Agent Based models

As the conference theme this year is “Making Complex Systems tractable through Computational Science”, papers highlighting the role of Computational Science in tackling the complex problems of today and tomorrow are particularly welcome.

## Paper Types and Publication

| Submission Type | Published in LNCS | Pages |
|---|---|---|
| Full Paper | ✓ | 12-15 |
| Short Paper | ✓ | 6-8 |
| Abstract | — | 2 |

ICCS is co-organised with the Workshops on Computational Science. Papers can be submitted to either the Main Conference or any of the Workshops via the same EasyChair link.

*   ICCS and WCS papers will be published in separate proceedings, but both will be published by LNCS and indexed in the same way.
*   The only difference between Full and Short papers is the number of accepted pages.
*   The “Abstract Only” option is for researchers who can only publish in specific journals or work for companies where publishing is not possible, but wish to present their work. In this option, a short abstract is included in the conference program, but not in LNCS.
*   After the conference, the best papers will be invited for a special issue of the Journal of Computational Science (Impact Factor: 3.1).

## Instructions for Authors

*   Manuscripts should be up to **15 pages**, written in English and formatted according to the Springer LNCS templates.
*   Submissions should be made electronically via [EasyChair](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=iccs2025).
*   The most recent versions of the Templates are available for download from [this link](https://www.iccs-meeting.org/iccs2025/templates-forms/).
*   The LaTeX2e Proceedings Templates are also available in the scientific authoring platform [Overleaf](https://www.overleaf.com/latex/learn/author-guidelines-for-springers-lncs-proceedings).
*   Please follow Springer’s [authors’ guidelines](https://resource-cms.springernature.com/springer-cms/rest/v1/content/19242230/data/v12) and Springer’s [Book Authors’ Code of Conduct](https://www.springernature.com/gp/authors/book-authors-code-of-conduct).
*   Papers must be based on unpublished original work and submitted only to ICCS.
*   Submission implies the willingness of at least one of the authors to register and present the paper.
*   ICCS emphasizes the explicit relevance of submitted contributions to Computational Science. Papers more relevant to specialized conferences may be desk-rejected.
*   To promote open science and reproducibility, ICCS encourages data and code sharing.

### Camera-Ready Information:

*   Authors interested in open access can contact the organizers for instructions.
*   Springer encourages authors to include their ORCIDs.
*   Springer is offering the inclusion of embedded videos in proceedings papers.

# ICCSA 2025: Call for Papers

The 25th International Conference on Computational Science and Its Applications (ICCSA 2025) will be organized in **Istanbul, Türkiye**, from **June 30 - July 3, 2025**, hosted by Galatasaray University.

ICCSA 2025 offers both **onsite and virtual participation options**, with virtual registration available at a reduced fee.

## Conference Themes

The conference themes are grouped into six tracks:

1.  **Track: Computational Methods, Algorithms and Scientific Application**
    *   Computational Biology
    *   Computational Combustion
    *   Computational Chemistry
    *   Computational Fluid Dynamics
    *   Computational Physics
    *   Computational Geometry
    *   Computational Mathematics
    *   Computational Mechanics
    *   Computational Electromagnetics
    *   Numerical Methods and Algorithms

2.  **Track: High-Performance Computing and Networks**
    *   Parallel and Distributed Computing
    *   Cluster Computing
    *   Supercomputing
    *   Cloud Computing
    *   Autonomic Computing
    *   P2P Computing
    *   Mobile Computing
    *   Grid and Semantic Grid Computing
    *   Workflow Design and Practice
    *   Computer and Network Architecture

3.  **Track: Geometric Modelling, Graphics and Visualization**
    *   Scientific Visualization
    *   Computer Graphics
    *   Geometric Modelling
    *   Pattern Recognition
    *   Image Processing
    *   CAD/CAM
    *   Web3D, Virtual and Augmented Reality

4.  **Track: Advanced and Emerging Applications**
    *   Biochemistry
    *   Bioinformatics
    *   Astrophysics
    *   Biometric Modelling
    *   Environmental, Climate and Weather Modelling
    *   Geology and Geophysics
    *   Nuclear Physics
    *   Financial and Economic Modelling
    *   Computational Journalism
    *   Geographical Information Systems

5.  **Track: Information Systems and Technologies**
    *   Information Retrieval
    *   Scientific Databases
    *   Security Engineering
    *   Risk Analysis
    *   Reliability Engineering
    *   Software Engineering
    *   Data Mining
    *   Artificial Intelligence
    *   Machine Learning
    *   Learning Technologies
    *   Web-Based Computing
    *   Web 2.0
    *   Blockchain

6.  **Track: Urban and Regional Planning**
    *   Urban and regional growth
    *   Sustainable urban and regional development
    *   Socio-ecological systems
    *   Open Data, Big Data
    *   Cultural Heritage
    *   Smart and Sustainable Cities
    *   Mobility and Intelligent Transport Systems
    *   Decision Support Systems
    *   Complexity assessment and mapping
    *   Logistics

## Submission Categories and Guidelines

*   **General Tracks and Workshops' Full Papers:** Submitted papers must be **between 12 and 18 pages long** and formatted according to LNCS rules. Please consult href="https://iccsa.org/instructions-for-authors" - https://iccsa.org/instructions-for-authors for formatting information and templates.
*   **Short Papers:** Reporting preliminary results of ongoing research. Papers must be **between 8 and 11 pages long** and formatted according to LNCS rules. Short papers will be presented during the conference and published by LNCS.
*   **PhD Showcase Papers:** Reporting ongoing research with significant results, primarily by PhD students and junior researchers. Papers must be **between 10 to 18 pages long** and formatted according to LNCS rules. PhD Showcase Papers will be presented during the conference and published by LNCS.

Each paper must be original, unpublished, and not submitted elsewhere.

## Submission Process

Submissions must be made electronically through the Submission site: href="https://ess.iccsa.org" - https://ess.iccsa.org .

## Important Dates

*   **Start of Workshop proposal submission:** October 7, 2024
*   **Deadline for Workshop proposal submission:** November 7, 2024
*   **Start of Abstract and Paper Submission:** November 8, 2024
*   **Deadline for abstract and paper submission to General Tracks:** **March 28, 2025** (Workshops may have their own deadlines).
*   **Deadline for reviewers:** April 15, 2025
*   **Notification of Acceptance:** April 20, 2025
*   **Submission deadline for the final version (hard deadline):** **May 8, 2025**
*   **Registration and payment ends (hard deadline):** **May 8, 2025**
*   **Conference Dates:** June 30 - July 3, 2025

## Publication

All accepted papers will be included in the **Springer Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS)** series. The proceedings are indexed by Scopus, EI Engineering Index, Thomson Reuters Conference Proceedings Citation Index, and other services. Authors of selected top-quality papers will be invited to submit extended versions for publication in special issues of recognized international journals.

## Review Process

Submitted papers will undergo a stringent peer review by at least three experts, evaluated based on originality, significance, technical soundness, and clarity. The review method is Single Blind.

# ICDS 2025: Call for Papers

The Nineteenth International Conference on Digital Society (ICDS 2025) will be held from **May 18, 2025 to May 22, 2025, in Nice, France**.

### Onsite and Online Options

In order to accommodate various situations, ICDS 2025 offers the option for either physical presence or virtual participation (pdf slides or pre-recorded videos).

ICDS 2025 is colocated with several other events as part of the **DigitalWorld 2025 Congress**.

# IEEE International Conference on Data Science and Engineering (ICDSE 2025): Call for Contributions

ICDE 2025, the 41st IEEE International Conference on Data Engineering, will take place in **Hong Kong SAR, China, from May 19 – 23, 2025**. ICDE is a leading forum for researchers, practitioners, developers, and users to explore cutting-edge ideas and exchange techniques, tools, and experiences in data and information engineering.

## Calls for Contributions

*   [Call for Research Paper](https://ieee-icde.org/2026/call-for-contributions/)
*   [Call for Industry and Application Papers](https://ieee-icde.org/2026/call-for-industry-and-application-papers/)
*   [Call for Demonstrations](https://ieee-icde.org/2026/call-for-demonstrations/)

*   [Call for PhD Symposium Submissions](https://ieee-icde.org/2026/call-for-phd-symposium-submissions/)
*   [Call for Data Engineering Future Technologies](https://ieee-icde.org/2026/call-for-data-engineering-future-technologies/)

## Call for Research Papers

### Topics of Interest

We invite original research contributions in the following areas as they relate to data management:

*   AI for Database Systems and Database Systems for AI
*   Benchmarking, Performance Modeling, Tuning, and Testing
*   Cloud Data Management
*   Crowdsourcing and Data Management
*   Data Mining and Knowledge Discovery from a Data Management Perspective (where scalability and efficiency are prominent aspects of the contribution)
*   Data Models, Semantics, Query languages
*   Data Stream Systems and Edge Computing
*   Very Large Data Visualization and Interactive Data Exploration
*   Database Security and Privacy
*   Distributed Ledgers and Blockchains
*   Distributed, Parallel and P2P Data Management
*   Explainability, Fairness, and Trust in Data Systems and Analysis
*   Graphs, Networks, and Semi-structured Data Management
*   Information Integration and Data Quality
*   IoT Data Management
*   Modern Hardware and In-Memory Database Systems
*   Query Processing, Indexing, and Optimization
*   Transaction Management
*   Spatial Databases and Temporal Databases
*   Text, Semi-Structured Data Management, Multimedia Databases
*   Information Retrieval from a Data Management Perspective (where scalability and efficiency are prominent aspects of the contribution)
*   Uncertain, Probabilistic, and Approximate Databases
*   Very Large Data Science Applications/Pipelines
*   Workflows, Scientific Data Management

We also welcome any original contributions that may cross the boundaries among areas or point in other novel directions of interest to the database research community.

### Important Dates

ICDE 2025 will have two rounds of research paper submissions.

*All deadlines are 11:59 PM AoE.*

**First Round:**

*   **Submission due:** August 2, 2024
*   **Notification for authors (Accept/Revise/Reject):** September 24, 2024
*   **Revision due:** October 29, 2024
*   **Notification to authors (Accept/Reject):** November 26, 2024
*   **Camera-ready copy due:** December 10, 2024

**Second Round:**

*   **Submission due:** November 25, 2024
*   **Notification for Authors (Accept/Revise/Reject):** January 21, 2025
*   **Revision Due:** February 25, 2025
*   **Notification to authors (Accept/Reject):** March 25, 2025
*   **Camera-ready copy due:** April 8, 2025

### Submission Guidelines

*   Paper should be submitted using the Conference Management Tool: [https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/ICDE2025](https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/ICDE2025).
*   Manuscripts must be prepared in accordance with the IEEE format available at [https://www.ieee.org/conferences_events/conferences/publishing/templates.html](https://www.ieee.org/conferences_events/conferences/publishing/templates.html).
*   Research papers must not exceed **12 pages**, not including references. No appendix is allowed.
*   Only electronic submissions in PDF format will be considered.
*   A paper submitted to ICDE 2025 cannot be under review for any other conference or journal during the entire time it is considered for ICDE 2025, and it must be substantially different from any previously published work.
*   A paper submitted to ICDE 2025 must present original work not described in any prior publication that is more than 4 double-column pages in length.
*   Any author of ICDE 2025 should not be a co-author of more than 10 submitted research papers across the two submission rounds.
*   Submissions will be reviewed in a **single-blind manner**.
*   Submissions that are rejected in the first round of the IEEE ICDE 2025 research track are not eligible for re-submission to the second round.
*   The best papers (as judged by the ICDE 2025 PC) will be selected for submission as an extended version to be published in the IEEE Transactions on Knowledge and Data Engineering (TKDE).

### Desk Rejection Policy

ICDE research track submissions that don’t meet the following requirements may be rejected without review:

*   Submissions must follow the aforementioned guidelines and length requirements specified in the ICDE 2025 Call for Papers.
*   Submissions must be in scope of ICDE 2025, aligning with at least one of the topic areas and situating itself within the state of the art of current and past research in the database community.
*   Authors must correctly declare all conflicts of interest (COI) with members of the program committee.

### Conflict of Interest (COI) Declaration

*   Each author of a submission must create a CMT profile and complete it with domain and individual conflicts.
*   If a CMT profile is missing for at least one author of a submission, the paper will be desk rejected.
*   Authors can mark their conflicts by clicking on their name (upper right-hand side on CMT) and selecting “Domain Conflicts” and “Individual Conflicts”.
*   A searchable spreadsheet of COIs is available for authors' convenience.

### Reviewing Process

*   Papers will be stringently reviewed with at least 3 reviews per paper.
*   Revisions: Papers may be invited for revision. Authors will have five weeks to prepare their revisions. The revision process is intended to be a constructive interaction between reviewers and authors.

### Diversity and Inclusion

We value Diversity and Inclusion in our community and profession. Be mindful in your writing of not using language or examples that further the marginalization, stereotyping, or erasure of any group of people. Reviewers will be empowered to monitor and demand changes if such issues arise.

### Acceptance and Attendance

IEEE reserves the right to exclude a paper from distribution (e.g., remove it from IEEE Xplore) after the conference if none of the authors attend the conference to present their paper.

# ICIMP 2025: Call for Papers

The Twentieth International Conference on Internet Monitoring and Protection (ICIMP 2025) will be held from **April 06, 2025 to April 10, 2025 in Valencia, Spain**.

### Onsite and Online Options

In order to accommodate various situations, the conference offers the option for either physical presence or virtual participation (pdf slides or pre-recorded videos).

## Scope

ICIMP 2025 focuses on security, performance, vulnerabilities in the Internet, and disaster prevention and recovery. It addresses the design, implementation, and deployment of large distributed systems, vulnerability assessment, system diagnosis, and the impact of attacks on user confidence, privacy, and economic losses.

The conference solicits both academic, research, and industrial contributions, including technical papers, position papers, survey papers, short papers on work in progress, and panel proposals. Industrial presentations are also welcome.

# ICIDS 2025: Call for Papers

The 18th International Conference on Interactive Digital Storytelling (ICIDS 2025) will be held in **Malta** from **December 1-5, 2025**.

This year's conference theme is **"Kaleidoscopic Machines"**, inspired by the convergence of AI and human creativity in narrative expression, reflecting Malta's rich history and future-oriented economy.

## Deadlines

*   **Extended Paper Submission Deadline:** June 22, 2025 (AOE)
*   **Workshop Submissions Deadline:** July 22, 2025

## Areas of Interest

Submissions are invited in the following areas:

### Theory, History, and Foundations
Exploring fundamental, theoretical aspects of interactive digital storytelling, narrative structures, interactivity, and the conceptual underpinnings of IDNs, including historical context.

### Methods and Tools
Research on frameworks, procedures, and pipelines supporting the analysis of principles, methods, rules, and postulates in the field. This includes innovative tools, methodologies (for validation or replication studies), and technical frameworks for creating IDNs.

### Applications and Case Studies
Explorations of interactive digital storytelling in practice, including educational applications, collaborative narrative experiences, virtual worlds, games, and performances, with attention to audience engagement and practical outcomes.

### Social, Cultural and Critical Perspectives
Analysis of sociocultural implications and ethical dimensions of interactive digital storytelling, including representation, accessibility, cultural context, power dynamics, and authorship issues, critically examining the impact of interactive narratives.

## Submission Categories

*   **Full papers:** 4000-6000 words (excluding references), to be published in the proceedings.
*   **Short papers:** 2000-4000 words (excluding references), to be published in the proceedings.
*   **Late Breaking Work:** 2000-3000 words (excluding references), to be published in the proceedings. These will be presented as demos or posters and are suitable for works in progress or unfinished research.

## Author Guidelines

*   **Anonymization:** ICIDS follows a strict double-peer review process. **Non-anonymized papers will be desk-rejected.**
*   **Language and Format:** Papers must be written in English. Only electronic submissions in **PDF format** will be considered for review.
*   **Publication:** Publication is conditional on a minimum of one author registering for the conference to present the work. Successful submissions will be included as part of the conference proceedings published by **Springer**.
*   **Formatting:** All submissions must follow the **Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS) format**. Templates can be found at [https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs](https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs).
*   **ORCID:** Authors are encouraged to include their ORCIDs in their papers.
*   **Consent-to-Publish:** The corresponding author must complete and sign a Consent-to-Publish form.
*   **AI Policy:** Authors should consult Springer’s AI policy: [https://www.springer.com/gp/editorial-policies/artificial-intelligence–ai-/25428500](https://www.springer.com/gp/editorial-policies/artificial-intelligence--ai-/25428500).
*   **Hybrid Attendance:** While in-person attendance is recommended, remote attendance is possible if no author can travel. Publication is conditional on registration and remote presentation (live or pre-recorded video).

## Submission Platform

Submissions are accepted through Easychair:

[SUBMIT PAPER](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=icids2025)

## Disclaimer

*   Beware of fake ICIDS conferences organised in Geneva, Switzerland, and Indonesia, which are not affiliated with ARDIN or this conference.
    *   [Fake ICIDS Conference 1](https://scienceguru.org/Conference/655/ICIDS/)
    *   [Fake ICIDS conference 2](https://scienceandresearch.net/Conference/1032/ICIDS/)
*   Submissions to these fake conferences will NOT be considered for acceptance to ARDIN’s ICIDS conference.

# ICISSP 2026: Call for Papers

The International Conference on Information Systems Security and Privacy (ICISSP) 2026 is an event where researchers and practitioners can meet and discuss state-of-the-art research about the technological, social, and regulatory challenges that regard the security, privacy, and trust of modern information systems. The conference welcomes papers of either practical or theoretical nature, and is interested in research or applications addressing all aspects of trust, security and privacy, and encompassing issues of concern for organizations, individuals and society at large.

ICISSP 2026 is held in conjunction with ICAART 2026, PHOTOPTICS 2026, ICPRAM 2026, BIOSTEC 2026 and ROBOVIS 2026. Registration to ICISSP allows free access to the other co-located conferences (as a non-speaker). Although the conference is back to the normal mode (i.e., in-person) speakers are allowed to present remotely if unable to travel to the venue (hybrid support).

## Conference Areas

Papers may address one or more of the listed sub-topics, although authors should not feel limited by them. Unlisted but related sub-topics are also acceptable, provided they fit in one of the following main topic areas:

1.  **MANAGEMENT AND OPERATIONS**
    *   Regulatory and Technical Compliance Aspects of Security and Privacy
    *   Risk and Reputation Management
    *   Identity and Trust Management
    *   Threat Awareness
    *   Intrusion Detection and Response
    *   Security Awareness and Education
    *   Malware Detection
    *   Vulnerability Analysis and Countermeasures
    *   Security and Privacy Metrics

2.  **APPLICATIONS AND SERVICES**
    *   Web Applications and Services
    *   Web 3.0 Security and Privacy
    *   Security and Privacy in Cloud and Pervasive Computing
    *   Privacy, Security and Trust in Social Media, Metaverse, and other Online Contexts
    *   AI and Machine Learning for Security
    *   Security in IoT and Edge Computing
    *   Mobile Security

3.  **TECHNOLOGIES AND FOUNDATIONS**
    *   Trusted Computing
    *   Access and Usage Control
    *   Security Testing
    *   Data and Software Security
    *   Privacy-Enhancing Models and Technologies
    *   Privacy and Security Models
    *   Cryptographic Algorithms
    *   Security Frameworks, Architectures and Protocols
    *   Authentication, Biometrics, Identification
    *   Security Architecture and Design Analysis

## Keynote Speakers

ICISSP 2026 will have several invited keynote speakers, who are internationally recognized experts in their areas. Their names are not yet confirmed.

## Paper Submission

Authors can submit their work in the form of a complete paper or an abstract, but please note that accepted abstracts are presented but not published in the proceedings of the conference. Complete papers can be submitted as a **Regular Paper**, representing completed and validated research, or as a **Position Paper**, portraying a short report of work in progress or an arguable opinion about an issue discussing ideas, facts, situations, methods, procedures or results of scientific research focused on one of the conference topic areas.

Authors should submit a paper in English, carefully checked for correct grammar and spelling, addressing one or several of the conference areas or topics. Each paper should clearly indicate the nature of its technical/scientific contribution, and the problems, domains or environments to which it is applicable. To facilitate the double-blind paper evaluation method, authors are kindly requested to produce and provide the paper **WITHOUT any reference to any of the authors**, including the authors’ personal details, the acknowledgments section of the paper and any other reference that may disclose the authors’ identity.

When submitting a complete paper please note that only original papers should be submitted. Authors are advised to read **INSTICC's ethical norms** regarding plagiarism and self-plagiarism thoroughly before submitting and must make sure that their submissions do not substantially overlap work which has been published elsewhere or simultaneously submitted to a journal or another conference with proceedings. Papers that contain any form of plagiarism will be rejected without reviews. Authors should also avoid using an excessive number of self-citations.

All papers must be submitted through the online submission platform **PRIMORIS** and should follow the instructions and templates that can be found under Guidelines and Templates. After the paper submission has been successfully completed, authors will receive an automatic confirmation e-mail.

## Publications

*   All accepted complete papers will be published in the conference proceedings, under an ISBN reference, on paper and on digital support.
*   SCITEPRESS is a member of CrossRef ([http://www.crossref.org/](http://www.crossref.org/)) and every paper on our digital library is given a DOI (Digital Object Identifier).
*   The proceedings will be submitted for indexation by SCOPUS, Google Scholar, DBLP, Semantic Scholar, EI and Web of Science / Conference Proceedings Citation Index.

# ICDT 2026: Call for Papers

ICDT (International Conference on Database Theory) is a series of international scientific conferences focused on research in the foundations and theory of data management. Since 2009, ICDT has been held annually and jointly with EDBT (Extending Database Technology).

The **29th edition of ICDT in 2026** is planned to take place in **Tampere, Finland, from March 24 to March 27, 2026**.

## Topics of Interest

We welcome research papers on every topic related to the principles and theory of data management, provided that there is a clear connection to foundational aspects. This includes:

*   Theoretical investigation of data management systems (e.g., Indexes, Concurrency and recovery, Distributed and parallel databases, Cloud computing, Privacy and security, Graph databases, Data streams and sketching, Data-centric process management, Data and knowledge integration, Data provenance, Views, Data warehouses, Domain-specific databases).
*   Design and study of data models and query languages.
*   Development and analysis of algorithms for data management.
*   Connections between data management and other areas such as knowledge representation, semantic web, web services, information retrieval and data mining, machine learning/AI, distributed computing, and theoretical computer science.

A clear emphasis on foundational aspects is expected for all submissions. The Program Committee reserves the right to desk reject submissions considered out of scope.

## Submission Cycles and Dates

ICDT will have two submission cycles for 2026:

### ICDT Submission Cycle 1

*   **Abstract submission:** March 13, 2025 (AoE)
*   **Paper submission:** March 20, 2025 (AoE)
*   **Notification:** June 1, 2025

### ICDT Submission Cycle 2

*   **Abstract submission:** September 3, 2025 (AoE)
*   **Paper submission:** September 10, 2025 (AoE)
*   **Notification:** December 1, 2025

*Note: Papers rejected in the first submission cycle cannot be submitted to the second submission cycle unless explicitly requested by the reviewers.*

## Submission Instructions

All submissions will be electronic via EasyChair: [https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=icdt2026](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=icdt2026)

*   Papers must be written in English and provide sufficient detail for assessment.
*   Papers must be submitted as PDF documents, using the LIPIcs style (http://www.dagstuhl.de/en/publications/lipics/instructions-for-authors).

## Tracks

1.  **Regular Research Papers** (15 pages, anonymized)
    *   Results must be unpublished and not submitted elsewhere.
    *   Maximum 15 pages, excluding references. Appendices are at the discretion of the PC.
    *   Papers must conform to LIPIcs formatting requirements.

2.  **Database Theory in Action** (4 pages + references, non-anonymized)
    *   Short papers illustrating applications of database theory in other domains or real-world problems.
    *   Can be based on previously published work.
    *   Titles must start with "Database Theory in Action:".
    *   Include pointers to relevant publications, websites, tools, etc.

## Publication

The proceedings will appear in the Leibniz International Proceedings in Informatics (LIPIcs) series, available online and free of charge. Authors retain rights over their work.

# Call for Papers

The Twentieth International Conference on Internet and Web Applications and Services (ICIW 2025) will be held from **April 06, 2025 to April 10, 2025, in Valencia, Spain**.

### Onsite and Online Options

In order to accommodate various situations, ICIW 2025 offers the option for either physical presence or virtual participation (pdf slides or pre-recorded videos).

## Scope

ICIW 2025 focuses on complementary aspects related to the design and deployment of applications based on IP & Web techniques and mechanisms. It comprises several tracks covering Web technologies, development of Web-based applications, interactions with other systems, management aspects, and specialized domains. The conference welcomes academic, research, and industrial contributions, including technical papers, position papers, survey papers, short papers on work in progress, and panel proposals. Industrial presentations are also accepted. All topics and submission formats are open to both research and industry contributions.

## Conference Tracks

ICIW 2025 features the following tracks:

*   **TRINT:** Trends on Internet-based data, applications and services
*   **TRWEB:** Trends on Web-driven applications and services
*   **ML:** Machine Learning for Web-based applications and Internet data
*   **MOBWEB:** Smart Mobile Web
*   **IWAS:** Internet and Web-based Applications and Services
*   **WSSA:** Web Services-based Systems and Applications
*   **ENSYS:** Entertainment Systems
*   **P2PSA:** P2P Systems and Applications
*   **ONLINE:** Online Communications, Collaborative Systems, and Social Networks

*   **VEWAeL:** Virtual Environments and Web Applications for eLearning
*   **VIDEO INFO:** Short video/links scientific content
*   **ECC:** Enterprise cloud computing

## Submission Types

Authors are invited to submit complete unpublished papers, which are not under review elsewhere. The following contribution types are accepted:

*   **Regular Papers:** (up to 6-10 pages; 6 pages covered by regular registration; max 4 extra pages allowed at additional cost) - oral presentation. These can be academic or industrial research, survey, white, implementation-oriented, or architecture-oriented papers. Included in proceedings and ThinkMind digital library, sent for indexing. Suggested 12-14 presentation slides.
*   **Short papers (work in progress):** (up to 4 pages long) - oral presentation. Welcome contributions representing partial achievements of longer-term projects. Published in proceedings, ThinkMind digital library, and sent for indexing. Suggested 12-14 presentation slides.
*   **Ideas contributions:** (2 pages long) - oral presentation. Dedicated to new ideas in their early stage, intended for debate and feedback. Published in proceedings, ThinkMind digital library, and sent for indexing. Suggested 12-14 presentation slides.
*   **Extended abstracts:** (2 pages long) - oral presentation. Summarize a potential publication with noticeable results, intended for sharing work in progress or future journal publications. Published in proceedings, ThinkMind digital library, and sent for indexing. Suggested 12-14 presentation slides.
*   **Posters (paper-based):** (two pages long) - oral presentation. For ongoing research projects, concrete realizations, or industrial applications/projects. Published in proceedings, ThinkMind digital library, and sent for indexing. Suggested 8-10 presentation slides. A large poster for live discussion is also suitable.
*   **Posters (slide-based, only):** (oral presentation). For ongoing research projects, concrete realizations, or industrial applications/projects. Slides will be posted on www.iaria.org post-event. Suggested 8-10 presentation slides.
*   **Presentations (slide-based, only):** (oral presentation). For technical marketing/industrial/business/positioning presentations. Slide-deck will be posted on www.iaria.org post-event. Suggested 12-14 presentation slides.
*   **Demos:** (two pages) - posted on www.iaria.org. Special contributions presenting tools, implementations, or new systems.

Tutorials and panel proposals are also encouraged.

*   Archived in the Open Access IARIA ThinkMind Digital Library.

# ICINCO 2025: Call for Papers

The International Conference on Informatics in Control, Automation and Robotics (ICINCO) will be held from **October 20-22, 2025**, at the **Barceló Marbella hotel** in **Marbella, Spain**.

ICINCO is sponsored by INSTICC and is held in conjunction with WEBIST 2025, icSPORTS 2025, CHIRA 2025, IJCCI 2025, IC3K 2025, and CoopIS 2025. Registration to ICINCO allows free access to these co-located conferences.

Although the conference is primarily in-person, speakers are allowed to present remotely if unable to travel to the venue (hybrid support).

## Scope

The purpose of ICINCO is to bring together researchers, engineers, and practitioners interested in the application of informatics to Control, Automation, and Robotics. Four simultaneous tracks will cover Intelligent Control Systems, Optimization, Robotics, Automation, Signal Processing, Sensors, Systems Modelling and Control, and Industrial Informatics.

Authors should highlight the benefits of Information Technology (IT) in these areas. Papers describing original work, advanced prototypes, systems, tools, techniques, and survey papers are welcome. Accepted papers, presented at the conference by one of the authors, will be published in the Proceedings of ICINCO with an ISBN and will be submitted for indexation by SCOPUS, Google Scholar, DBLP, Semantic Scholar, EI, and Web of Science / Conference Proceedings Citation Index.

# Call for Research Papers - ICDE 2025

## Overview

The annual IEEE International Conference on Data Engineering (ICDE) is one of the premier conferences in data and information engineering. It addresses research issues on designing, building, managing, and evaluating advanced data-intensive systems and applications, serving as a leading forum for researchers, practitioners, developers, and users.

ICDE 2025 will take place in **Hong Kong SAR, China, from May 19 – 23, 2025**.

## Topics of Interest

We invite the submission of original research contributions in the following areas as they relate to data management:

*   AI for Database Systems and Database Systems for AI
*   Benchmarking, Performance Modeling, Tuning, and Testing
*   Cloud Data Management
*   Crowdsourcing and Data Management
*   Data Mining and Knowledge Discovery from a Data Management Perspective (where scalability and efficiency are prominent aspects of the contribution)
*   Data Models, Semantics, Query languages
*   Data Stream Systems and Edge Computing
*   Very Large Data Visualization and Interactive Data Exploration
*   Database Security and Privacy
*   Distributed Ledgers and Blockchains
*   Distributed, Parallel and P2P Data Management
*   Explainability, Fairness, and Trust in Data Systems and Analysis
*   Graphs, Networks, and Semi-structured Data Management
*   Information Integration and Data Quality
*   IoT Data Management
*   Modern Hardware and In-Memory Database Systems
*   Query Processing, Indexing, and Optimization
*   Transaction Management
*   Spatial Databases and Temporal Databases
*   Text, Semi-Structured Data Management, Multimedia Databases
*   Information Retrieval from a Data Management Perspective (where scalability and efficiency are prominent aspects of the contribution)
*   Uncertain, Probabilistic, and Approximate Databases
*   Very Large Data Science Applications/Pipelines
*   Workflows, Scientific Data Management

We also welcome any original contributions that may cross the boundaries among areas or point in other novel directions of interest to the database research community.

## Important Dates

ICDE 2025 will have two rounds of research paper submissions.

*All deadlines are 11:59PM AoE.*

### First Round:

*   **Submission due:** August 2, 2024
*   **Notification for authors (Accept/Revise/Reject):** September 24, 2024
*   **Revision due:** October 29, 2024
*   **Notification to authors (Accept/Reject):** November 26, 2024
*   **Camera-ready copy due:** December 10, 2024

### Second Round:

*   **Submission due:** November 25, 2024
*   **Notification for Authors (Accept/Revise/Reject):** January 21, 2025
*   **Revision Due:** February 25, 2025
*   **Notification to authors (Accept/Reject):** March 25, 2025
*   **Camera-ready copy due:** April 8, 2025

## Submission Guidelines

*   Papers should be submitted using the Conference Management Tool: [https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/ICDE2025](https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/ICDE2025).
*   Manuscripts must be prepared in accordance with the IEEE format available at [https://www.ieee.org/conferences_events/conferences/publishing/templates.html](https://www.ieee.org/conferences_events/conferences/publishing/templates.html).
*   Research papers must not exceed **12 pages** (not including references). No appendix is allowed.
*   Only electronic submissions in PDF format will be considered.
*   A paper submitted to ICDE 2025 cannot be under review for any other conference or journal during the entire time it is considered for ICDE 2025, and it must be substantially different from any previously published work.
*   Any author of ICDE 2025 should not be a co-author of more than 10 submitted research papers across the two submission rounds.
*   Submissions will be reviewed in a **single-blind manner**.
*   Submissions that were desk rejected in Round 1 due to COI violations, failure to follow length and formatting instructions, or being out of scope for ICDE may be resubmitted in Round 2.

## Desk Rejection Policy

ICDE research track submissions that don’t meet the following requirements may be rejected without review:

*   Submissions must follow the aforementioned guidelines and length requirements.
*   Submissions must be in scope of ICDE 2025.
*   Authors must correctly declare all conflicts of interest (COI) with members of the program committee.

## Conflict of Interest (COI)

An author X of an ICDE 2025 research paper has a COI with a PC member or Area Chair Y if and only if one or more of the following conditions hold:

1.  X is a co-author of another ICDE 2025 submission together with Y.
2.  X has been a co-author of Y in a publication in the past three years.
3.  X has been a co-author of Y for 4 (or more) publications in the last 10 years.
4.  X has been a co-worker of Y in the same company or university within the past three years.
5.  X has been a collaborator of Y within the past three years (e.g., held a joint grant).
6.  X is or was Y’s primary thesis advisor or vice versa, no matter how long ago.
7.  X is a relative or a close personal friend of Y (or vice versa).

## Reviewing Process

*   Papers will be stringently reviewed with at least 3 reviews per paper.
*   Papers may be invited to submit a revised version if the PC believes the papers can reasonably be improved within the allocated revision time frame. Authors will have five weeks to prepare their revisions.

## Best Paper Awards

The best papers (as judged by the ICDE 2025 PC) will be selected for submission as an extended version to be published in the IEEE Transactions on Knowledge and Data Engineering (TKDE).

## Attendance Requirement

IEEE reserves the right to exclude a paper from distribution (e.g., remove it from IEEE Xplore) after the conference if none of the authors attend the conference to present their paper.

## Diversity and Inclusion

We value Diversity and Inclusion in our community and profession. Both are important in our writing as well. Be mindful in your writing of not using language or examples that further the marginalization, stereotyping, or erasure of any group of people, especially historically marginalized and/or under-represented groups (URGs) in computing. Reviewers will be empowered to monitor and demand changes if such issues arise.

The 41st Conference on Mathematical Foundations of Programming Semantics (MFPS 2025) will take place from **June 18-20, 2025**, at the **University of Strathclyde in Glasgow, Scotland**. This conference is held **jointly with CALCO**.

## About MFPS

MFPS conferences are dedicated to the areas of mathematics, logic, and computer science that are related to models of computation in general, and to semantics of programming languages in particular. It serves as a forum for researchers in mathematics and computer science to exchange ideas, and participation from neighbouring areas is strongly encouraged.

The International Conference on Management of Digital EcoSystems (MEDES) aims to bring together a diverse community from academia, research laboratories and industry interested in exploring the manifold challenges and issues related to web technologies and resource management of Digital Ecosystems. # MEMOCODE 2025: Call for Papers

MEMOCODE: ACM/IEEE International Symposium on Formal Methods and Models for System Design

Over the last decade, the boundaries between computer system components, such as hardware, software, firmware, middleware, and applications, have blurred. This evolution in system design and development practices led in 2014 to a change in the title and scope of the MEMOCODE conference from its original focus on hardware/software co-design to its new focus on formal methods and models for developing computer systems and their components. MEMOCODE’s objective is to emphasize the importance of models and methodologies in correct system design and development, and to bring together researchers and industry practitioners interested in all aspects of computer system development, to exchange ideas, research results and lessons learned.

# MPLR 2025: Call for Papers

The 22nd International Conference on Managed Programming Languages & Runtimes (MPLR, formerly ManLang, originally PPPJ) is a premier forum for presenting and discussing novel results in all aspects of managed programming languages and runtime systems. MPLR 2025 is co-located with ICFP/SPLASH 2025 and will be held from **October 12 to October 18, 2025, in Singapore**.

## Topics of Interest

The areas of interest include but are not limited to:

### Languages and Compilers

*   Managed languages (e.g., Java, Scala, JavaScript, Python, Ruby, C#, F#, Clojure, Groovy, Kotlin, R, Smalltalk, Racket, Rust, Go, Lua, MATLAB, Raku, Pony, …)
*   Domain-specific languages
*   Language design
*   Compilers and interpreters
*   Type systems and program logics
*   Language interoperability
*   Parallelism, distribution, and concurrency

### Virtual Machines

*   Portable intermediate representations (e.g., JVM, WebAssembly, RPython, …)
*   Managed runtime systems (e.g., GraalVM, Android Runtime (ART), V8, JavaScriptCore, .NET, …)
*   VM design and optimization
*   VMs for mobile and embedded devices
*   VMs for real-time applications
*   Memory management and garbage collection
*   Hardware/software co-design
*   Persistence

### Techniques, Tools, and Applications

*   Static and dynamic program analysis
*   Testing and debugging
*   Refactoring
*   Program understanding
*   Program synthesis
*   Security and privacy
*   Performance analysis and monitoring
*   Compiler and program verification and model checking

For questions regarding topics, please contact Program Chair Tomoharu Ugawa at ugawa@ci.i-u.tokyo.ac.jp.

## Submission Categories

MPLR accepts three types of submissions:

1.  **Regular research papers:** Describing novel contributions involving managed language platforms. Papers will be evaluated based on their relevance, novelty, technical rigor, and contribution to the state-of-the-art. (Format: up to **12 pages**, excluding bibliography and appendix).
2.  **Work-in-progress research papers:** Describing hot topics or promising new ideas, with perhaps less maturity than full papers. Papers will be evaluated with an emphasis on novelty and the potential of new ideas. (Format: up to **6 pages**, excluding bibliography and appendix).
3.  **Industry and tool papers:** Presenting technical challenges and solutions for managed language platforms in the context of deployed applications and systems. Papers will be evaluated on their relevance, usefulness, and results. Suitability for demonstration and availability will also be considered. (Format: up to **6 pages**, excluding bibliography and appendix; up to **12 pages** allowed if justified).

Accepted submissions will be published in the ACM Digital Library, unless authors prefer not to be included.

MPLR 2025 submissions must conform to the ACM Policy on Prior Publication and Simultaneous Submissions and to the SIGPLAN Republication Policy. See http://www.sigplan.org/Resources/Policies/Republication

## Author Instructions

*   Submissions need to use the ACM SIGPLAN format with the `sigplan` style.
*   Use the `acmart` document class with the `sigplan` option (not `sigconf`). Refer to `samples/sample-sigplan.tex` for guidance. On Overleaf, change the documentclass option `manuscript` to `sigplan`.
*   For ease of reviewing, please include page numbers in your submission using `\settopmatter{printfolios=true}`.
*   All submissions need to be in **PDF format**.
*   MPLR uses **double-blind reviewing**. Authors should not show their names on a submission and should refer to their own work in the third person. Avoid publicizing the work while it is under review.
*   Ensure legibility when printed on a black and white printer (distinct colors, legible font sizes).

The Thirteenth International Conference on Model & Data Engineering (MEDI 2024), ranked C By CORE 2021, will be held from **November 18 - 20, 2024** in **Naples, Italy**.

# MODELSWARD 2026: Call for Papers

The International Conference on Model-Based Software and Systems Engineering (MODELSWARD 2026) provides a platform for participants to present research results and application experience in using model-based techniques for developing all sorts of systems. The conference aims at fostering the further development and application of model-based techniques for the construction and analysis of software and systems.

MODELSWARD 2026 will be held from **March 7 to 9, 2026**, in conjunction with other INSTICC events, offering **hybrid support** (remote presentation is allowed if unable to travel).

## Scope

MODELSWARD is an opportunity for researchers and practitioners to discuss and move forward the ecosystem of model-based software and systems engineering techniques, languages, and tools. Accepted papers, presented at the conference by one of the authors, will be published in the MODELSWARD proceedings. Submissions will be reviewed by at least three experts and acceptance will be based on quality, relevance, and originality. The conference is open to full research and (short) work-in-progress papers, with sessions for both oral and poster presentations.

## Conference Areas

1.  **Methodologies, Processes and Platforms**
    *   Agile Model-Based Development
    *   Business Process Management (Modeling, Enactment and Execution)
    *   Frameworks for Model-Based Development
    *   Multi-level and Multi-view Modeling
    *   Model Transformations and Generative Approaches
    *   Artificial Intelligence (AI) for Modeling Support

2.  **Software and System Engineering**
    *   Model-Based System Engineering (MBSE)
    *   Model-Based Software Development
    *   Model-Based Development of Cyber Physical Systems
    *   Model-Based Engineering of Digital Twins
    *   Enterprise Architecture Modeling
    *   Model-Based Product Lines
    *   Model Execution and Simulation
    *   Model Quality Assessment
    *   Model-Based Testing and Validation
    *   Model Management
    *   Modeling for AI Applications

3.  **Modeling Languages, Tools and Architectures**
    *   General-Purpose Modeling Languages and Standards
    *   Domain-Specific Modeling
    *   Domain-specific LLMs
    *   RAG-based LLMs
    *   Modeling Language Engineering
    *   Modeling Language Syntax and Semantics
    *   Reasoning about Models
    *   Model Transformation
    *   Model-Based Services Infrastructures
    *   Modeling Environments

## Keynote Lectures

Invited keynote speakers, who are internationally recognized experts, are planned. Their names are not yet confirmed.

## Paper Submission

Authors can submit their work as a **complete paper** or an **abstract**. Accepted abstracts are presented but not published in the proceedings.

*   **Complete papers** can be submitted as a **Regular Paper** (completed and validated research) or a **Position Paper** (work in progress or an arguable opinion).
*   Papers must be in English and carefully checked for grammar and spelling.
*   **Double-blind review:** Papers must be submitted WITHOUT any reference to authors' identity, including personal details and acknowledgments.
*   Only original papers should be submitted. Authors must adhere to INSTICC's ethical norms regarding plagiarism and self-plagiarism.
*   Submission platform: PRIMORIS.
*   Accepted file formats: .pdf or .doc.

## Publications

All accepted complete papers will be published in the conference proceedings (ISBN, digital support) and will be given a DOI. Proceedings will be submitted for indexation by SCOPUS, Google Scholar, DBLP, Semantic Scholar, EI, and Web of Science/Conference Proceedings Citation Index. A short list of best papers will be invited for a post-conference special issue of the Springer Nature Computer Science Journal.

# ICFP 2025: Call for Papers

The ACM SIGPLAN International Conference on Functional Programming (ICFP) 2025 invites submissions on the design, implementations, principles, and uses of functional programming. This year, ICFP is co-located with SPLASH as part of the joint **ICFP/SPLASH 2025 conference**, taking place in **Singapore** from **October 12 to October 18, 2025**.

PACMPL (ICFP) seeks original papers on the art and science of functional programming, covering the entire spectrum of work from practice to theory.

## Topics of Interest

Topics of interest include (but are not limited to):

*   **Language Design:** concurrency, parallelism, distribution, modularity, components, meta-programming, macros, pattern matching, type systems (type inference, dependent types, effect types, gradual types, refinement types, session types), interoperability, domain-specific languages, imperative programming, object-oriented programming, logic programming, probabilistic programming, reactive programming, generic programming, bidirectional programming.
*   **Implementation:** abstract machines, virtual machines, interpretation, compilation, optimization, garbage collection, runtime systems, multi-threading, parallel hardware exploitation, foreign function interfaces.
*   **Software-Development Techniques:** algorithms, data structures, design patterns, specification, verification, validation, proof assistants, debugging, testing, tracing, profiling, build systems, program synthesis.
*   **Foundations:** formal semantics, lambda calculus, program equivalence, rewriting, type theory, logic, category theory, computational effects, continuations, control, state, names, binding, program verification.
*   **Analysis and Transformation:** control flow, data flow, abstract interpretation, partial evaluation, program calculation.
*   **Applications:** symbolic computing, formal-methods tools, artificial intelligence, systems programming, distributed systems, web programming, hardware design, databases, scientific and numerical computing, graphical user interfaces, graphics, multimedia, GPU programming, scripting, system administration, security.
*   **Education:** teaching introductory programming, mathematical proof, algebra.

## Submission Types

In addition to research papers, ICFP 2025 also welcomes:

*   **Functional Pearls:** Elegant essays on functional programming, which may include new perspectives on old ideas, instructive examples, nifty data structures, interesting applications, or classroom uses. These are valued and judged rigorously, focusing on conciseness, instructiveness, and entertainment.
*   **Experience Reports:** Descriptions of practical experiences using functional programming in industry, tool development, or education. These papers need not report original research but should illuminate aspects of functional programming use, providing evidence for a clear thesis.

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Review Process:** ICFP 2025 will employ a **full double-blind reviewing process**. Authors must omit their names and institutions from submissions, and refer to their own work in the third person.
*   **Formatting:** Submissions must be in **PDF format**, printable in black and white on US Letter paper, and adhere to the **“ACM Small” template** (available in LaTeX and Word).
    *   Full papers and Functional Pearls: up to **25 pages** (bibliography and optional appendix excluded).
    *   Experience Reports: up to **12 pages** (bibliography excluded).
*   **Submission System:** Submissions are accepted via href="https://icfp25.hotcrp.com/" - https://icfp25.hotcrp.com/ .
*   **Supplementary Material:** Authors may include a clearly marked appendix and/or attach supplementary material. All supplementary material must be anonymized and uploaded at submission time; URLs pointing to external repositories are not permitted.
*   **ORCID:** ACM requires an ORCID iD for every author. Please ensure you have all coauthors' ORCID iDs before submitting.
*   **Republication Policy:** Submissions must adhere to SIGPLAN’s republication policy.

## Important Dates (AoE - Anywhere on Earth)

*   **Submission Deadline:** Thursday, **27 February 2025**
*   **Author Response Period:** Monday, 28 April 2025 - Thursday, 1 May 2025
*   **Notification of Conditional Acceptance:** Friday, 23 May 2025
*   **Deadline for Submitting Revisions:** Thursday, 12 June 2025
*   **Final Decision Notification:** Friday, 27 June 2025
*   **Camera-Ready Deadline:** Friday, 11 July 2025

## Artifact Evaluation

Authors of conditionally accepted papers are encouraged to submit supporting materials for Artifact Evaluation. Successfully evaluated artifacts will receive a seal of approval.

## Contact

Please contact the Program Chair if you have questions or concerns about the appropriateness of a topic.

# OOPSLA 2025: Call for Papers

The OOPSLA issue of the Proceedings of the ACM on Programming Languages (PACMPL) welcomes papers focusing on all practical and theoretical investigations of programming systems, languages, and environments. Papers may target any stage of software development, including requirements, modeling, prototyping, design, implementation, generation, analysis, verification, testing, evaluation, maintenance, and reuse of software systems. Contributions may include the development of new tools, techniques, principles, and evaluations.

OOPSLA 2025 will have **two rounds of reviewing**. New papers may be submitted to either round. Papers accepted in either round will be published in the 2025 volume of PACMPL(OOPSLA) and invited to present at the SPLASH conference in 2025.

## What’s New

*   **Reserve Reviewer Policy**
*   **Data-Availability Statement**

## Contact

You can reach the two Review Committee Chairs (Shriram and Sukyoung) through this email: [oopsla-2025-rc-chairs@googlegroups.com](mailto:oopsla-2025-rc-chairs@googlegroups.com). Please allow 1–2 working days for a response, and longer right around deadlines. In your email, please mention the number of the paper you are writing about (if you have one) to facilitate tracking.

## Review Process

PACMPL(OOPSLA) employs two rounds of reviewing. Each paper will typically receive three or more reviews, and authors will have an opportunity to respond to these reviews before decisions are finalized.

At the end of each round, each paper will receive one of the five following decisions:

*   **Accept:** Your paper will appear in the upcoming volume of PACMPL(OOPSLA).
*   **Reject:** Your paper will not appear in the upcoming volume of PACMPL(OOPSLA). A resubmission in less than a year from the original submission is not guaranteed a review if judged substantially similar.
*   **Conditional Accept:** Specific required revisions are needed.
*   **Minor Revision:** Several concerns need to be addressed, potentially requiring specific revisions and broader comments.
*   **Major Revision:** Significant concerns requiring substantial revisions and broader comments, potentially taking longer to execute.

If you receive a Conditional Accept, Minor Revision, or Major Revision decision:

*   There is no restriction on when you can submit your revision.
*   You must submit a clear explanation of how your revision addresses comments, and, if possible, a diff of the PDFs.
*   Submissions will be reviewed by the same reviewers to the extent possible.
*   Unless explicitly withdrawn, your paper is considered under review, and submitting it elsewhere would violate policy.
*   Maintain submission anonymity. If violation is necessary to respond to reviews, discuss with the Chairs first.
*   Conditionally Accepted papers will be invited to submit artifacts for evaluation. Acceptance of artifacts has no impact on paper acceptance.
*   Only **Accepted** and **Conditionally Accepted** papers can submit artifacts for evaluation, as revisions often affect artifacts.

## Reserve Reviewer Policy

To uphold high review standards and manage review loads, for each paper, at least one **senior author** must register as a reserve reviewer on [TPMS](https://www.sigplan.org/Resources/TPMS/), unless exempt.

**Instructions:** Log into TPMS with your HotCRP email. Upload or provide URLs for 5-10 of your previous papers to inform reviewer matching, prioritizing depth, breadth, and rare expertise.

**Definition of Senior Author:** Completed their PhD five or more years ago.

**Exemptions:** A paper is exempt if:

*   It has no senior authors.
*   At least one senior author is already in the RC for this conference.
*   Every senior author satisfies one or more of these criteria:
    *   Is new to SIGPLAN (never published in it before).
    *   Is chairing a SIGPLAN conference with 150+ submissions last year, this year, or next year.
    *   Has other exceptional circumstances preventing reviewing, cleared with RC Chairs at least three days before submission.

One person may serve as a reserve reviewer for multiple papers; enter their information identically for each.

## Submission Guidelines

### Template

Use SPLASH’s PACMPL templates and instructions available on the [SIGPLAN author information page](https://www.sigplan.org/Resources/Author/). Papers should begin with:

```
\documentclass[acmsmall,screen,review]{acmart}
```

### Page Limit

*   **Initial submissions** must be at most **23 pages** using the template. This limit excludes required statements, references, or supplementary material. Papers must be self-contained; reviewers are not obliged to read supplementary material.
*   **Revisions** (including papers from 2024, and final camera-ready papers) can go up to a maximum of **25 pages**. There will be no option to purchase additional pages.

### Anonymity

PACMPL uses **double-blind reviewing**, meaning authors’ identities are only revealed if a paper is accepted. Your papers must:

*   Omit author names and institutions.
*   Use the third person when referencing your own work (e.g., "We extend Smith’s [2004] work on statically typed toads." instead of "We extend our earlier work on statically typed toads [Smith 2004]").
*   Anonymize supplementary material.
*   Suppress acknowledgments entirely until camera-ready.
*   Avoid linking to webpages in your anonymized paper.
*   Disguise or remove document properties (e.g., author name) from PDF files.

> Nothing should be done in the name of anonymity that weakens the submission. When in doubt, contact the Review Committee Chairs.

> If your system is not new and likely known, refer to it as if created by a third party.

> If your submission is based on code in a public repository, cite the code but replace the URL with "link removed for double-blind review". For reviewer access during author response, contact the Review Committee Chairs.

> If submitting an extension of a workshop paper, anonymize references to that work and change the paper title to break a direct link.

### Novelty

Papers must describe unpublished work not currently submitted for publication elsewhere, as per [SIGPLAN’s Re-Publication Policy](https://www.sigplan.org/Resources/Policies/Republication/). Submitters should also be aware of [ACM’s Policy and Procedures on Plagiarism](https://www.acm.org/publications/policies/plagiarism-detection-policy) and comply with [ACM’s Policies for Authorship](https://www.acm.org/publications/policies/new-acm-policy-on-authorship).

### Data-Availability Statement

Add a section titled **"Data-Availability Statement"** just before references in the initial submission. This will not count towards the page limit but should be limited to at most a few paragraphs (usually one suffices).

In this statement, indicate whether an artifact exists, its nature and limitations, and whether it will be submitted for Artifact Evaluation. This section can include links to preliminary versions of (anonymized) artifacts, datasets, etc., that reviewers *may* find useful (but are not obligated to follow).

> It is understood that some papers have no artifacts; in such cases, explain why. The absence of such an explanation can be cause for rejection.

> Accepted papers that fail to provide an artifact after promising one will be asked to explain the omission.

Artifact Evaluation submission will closely follow paper notification, so review the [Artifact Call](https://2025.splashcon.org/track/splash-2025-oopsla-artifacts) as soon as you submit your paper.

### Procedure

Submit your paper using [HotCRP](https://oopsla2425.hotcrp.com/).

## Publication

PAPMPL is a **Gold Open Access journal**, meaning all papers will be freely available to the public. Authors can voluntarily cover the article processing charge (**USD 400**), but payment is not required.

The official publication date is when the journal is available in the ACM Digital Library. Round 1 accepted papers (OOPSLA1) will be published no earlier than **April 1, 2025**, and Round 2 accepted papers (OOPSLA2) no earlier than **October 1, 2025**. This date affects patent filings related to published work.

## ACM Policies

By submitting, you acknowledge that you and your co-authors are subject to all [ACM Publications Policies](https://www.acm.org/publications/policies), including ACM’s new [Publications Policy on Research Involving Human Participants and Subjects](https://www.acm.org/publications/policies/research-involving-human-participants-and-subjects). Alleged violations may lead to paper retraction and other penalties.

Ensure you and your co-authors obtain an [ORCID iD](https://authors.acm.org/author-resources/orcid-faqs) to complete the publishing process, aiding author discoverability and attribution.

The [updated ACM Authorship Policy](https://www.acm.org/publications/policies/new-acm-policy-on-authorship) addresses the use of generative AI, clarifies authorship criteria and responsibilities, and defines prohibited behaviors like gift, ghost, or purchased authorship.

## FAQ

### What are reviewers looking for?

Reviewers consider the following criteria:

*   **Novelty:** Presents new ideas and results, properly contextualized within existing research.
*   **Importance:** Contributes to the advancement of knowledge in the field, including work that diverges from dominant trajectories.
*   **Evidence:** Provides sufficient support for claims (e.g., proofs, implemented systems, experimental results, statistical analyses, user studies, case studies, anecdotes).
*   **Clarity:** Contributions, methodology, and results are presented clearly.

### How are papers from previous years handled?

For resubmissions from previous OOPSLA years, the same timeline applies. The organizers attempt to assign the same reviewers and strongly discourage reviewers from issuing another "major revision" decision.

### Are artifacts required?

No. It is understood that some papers have no artifacts. However, if the paper's content and claims suggest an artifact should exist, authors must explain why one will not be provided. Lack of such an explanation can lead to rejection.

### Can a paper be accepted if the artifact is rejected?

Yes. Artifacts may be rejected for reasons unrelated to research results (e.g., packaging issues).

### Am I allowed to post my paper on my web page or arXiv, send it to colleagues, give a talk about it, mention it on social media, …?

The goal is to balance scientific communication with preventing potential reviewers from learning author identities. You may discuss work under submission, but avoid broadly advertising it through media likely to reach your reviewers. When in doubt, contact the Review Committee Chairs for guidance.

**Things you may do:**

*   Put your submission on your home page, arXiv, or other pre-publication sites.
*   Discuss your work with anyone not on the review committees or reviewers with whom you already have a conflict.
*   Present your work at professional meetings, job interviews, etc.
*   Submit work previously discussed at an informal workshop, previously posted on a pre-publication site, or previously submitted to a conference not using double-blind reviewing.

**Things you should not do:**

*   Contact members of the review committee about your work, or deliberately present your work where you expect them to be.
*   Publicize your work on social media in an identifiable way with broad settings (e.g., describing the work or giving its title). A general post about paper submission is acceptable.

> Reviewers will not be asked to recuse themselves unless they feel you have deliberately advertised your authorship information to them.

# SERA 2025: Call for Papers

The 23rd IEEE/ACIS International Conference on Software Engineering, Management and Applications (SERA 2025) brings together researchers, scientists, engineers, industry practitioners, and students to discuss, encourage, and exchange new ideas, research results, and experiences on all aspects of Software Engineering, Management, and Applications.

The conference will take place from **May 29-31, 2025**, at the **UNLV Campus in Las Vegas, USA**.

callForPapers:
# NordiCHI 2026: Welcome to Participate

We warmly invite you to join us in **Vaasa, Finland**, from **October 3-7, 2026**, for NordiCHI 2026, the Nordic Conference on Human-Computer Interaction.

NordiCHI 2026 is an international conference dedicated to bringing together the Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) community and providing a platform for engaging in state-of-the-art discussions that propel HCI forward.

## Conference Theme

Our conference theme, **Pulse – exploring the energy that drives us**, represents the dynamic highs and calm lows of life, keeping us thriving. Vaasa, known for its vibrant energy industry and the tranquility of its surrounding nature and UNESCO World Heritage site, serves as the perfect backdrop for exploring the elements of life in the coming ages of HCI.

## Program and Participation

Our program will include sessions that reflect a wide range of perspectives—from theoretical and practical insights to creative explorations. We invite you to participate in:

*   Insightful panels
*   Dynamic workshops and tutorials
*   Demonstrations that highlight innovative research and applications in HCI
*   Arts-based approaches that integrate creative expression with HCI research
*   Informal coffee-table discussions for reflection and idea exchange
*   Industry sessions that connect practitioners with researchers to share practical insights
*   Thought-provoking critiques
*   Poster presentations showcasing late-breaking work

These sessions provide ample opportunities for collaboration and engagement.

## Important Notes

> Specific submission guidelines, deadlines for paper submissions, and registration fees are not yet detailed in the provided information. Please refer to the official conference website closer to the event for updates.

## Contact Information

For any inquiries, please contact the organizers at:

*   **Email:** `nordichi2026@uwasa.fi`

We look forward to welcoming you to Vaasa for an intellectually stimulating and socially enriching conference experience!
